stream_context.summary: Kaze alternates between designing the huge overworld for "Return to Yoshi's Island" and debugging a major rewrite of Mario 64’s sound engine. He also brainstorms video thumbnail ideas, discusses upcoming RNG improvements, and talks through legal and release-timing constraints.

development_findings.summary: Kaze rewrote Mario 64’s entire sound engine: 80 % faster, one-quarter the code size, lower memory use, and 32 simultaneous notes (up from 16).
development_findings.quote: The sound engine is now around 80 % faster than vanilla, the code is around a quarter of the size, we need much less memory, and we support 32 notes instead of 16.

development_findings.summary: The vanilla engine’s mysterious limit on adding new sound effects motivated the rewrite; Kaze still hasn’t identified the original cause but ensured the new engine removes it.
development_findings.quote: Ideally, once I'm done with it, it will allow us to add a lot more sound effects. In vanilla Mario 64, if you try to add sound effects, it doesn't really work … I'm sure my rework doesn't have that issue anymore.

development_findings.summary: Overworld design goals: biggest level ever (~30 stars), distinct Yoshi villages, Bowser entrance kept visually separate, mountain and hammock tree areas to avoid empty space, climbable trees, potential boat paths.
development_findings.quote: We need a good bit of space between Bowser’s area and the Yoshi Village, otherwise it feels weird … This level will have like 30 stars or something.

development_findings.summary: Kaze wants post-game persistence: after the player saves the world, the game will not reset to a pre-victory state, allowing exploration of the ‘saved’ world.
development_findings.quote: I want the player to save the world and then be like, yep, this is the world now. You saved it. Look at that.

development_findings.summary: Legal strategy under consideration: may require every texture to be custom to reduce Nintendo risk; many textures already custom but Biobak (and possibly additional artists) will eventually replace the rest.
development_findings.quote: If I want this to all be legal, I would technically need custom textures for everything … then I'll get a bunch of texture artists to help with that.

development_findings.summary: Upcoming video & in-game change: new RNG algorithm that blends real-world entropy (e.g., temperature) to ‘perfect’ randomness on N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: The video is about finding a new RNG algorithm that uses real-world entropy as well … I discovered the temperature thing because I realized this is actually using real-world entropy.

context_findings.summary: Time-management philosophy: he views ‘finding time’ as eliminating wasted free time; works a regular programming job but devotes remaining hours to the hack.
context_findings.quote: Honestly, it's not that hard to find time for this stuff. If you think about your day-to-day, I'm sure you'll find that you waste most of your free time.

context_findings.summary: Financial motivation: sponsorships drive frequent YouTube videos; he needs more money and spends up to two days recording footage even with an editor.
context_findings.quote: I know the videos are coming fast recently. It is because I find sponsors … I want the money. I gotta find a way to record footage faster though.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: German-born, now living in Canada after marrying Zeina; permanent residency secured and citizenship test looming; age 29.
context_findings.quote: I moved to Canada in November 2021 … in two months I can take the citizenship test and then I will be a Canadian citizen.

context_findings.summary: Release anxiety: cannot announce or release near any big Nintendo launch to avoid legal retaliation.
context_findings.quote: If I release this I have to find a period of time where Nintendo is not dropping any big announcement … If I do they will literally kill me.

biobak.summary: Responsible for ‘a lot’ of custom textures; several levels still waiting for his rework.
biobak.quote: Biobak is making a lot of custom textures but not literally every texture is custom … there are still so many levels for Biobak to rework.

key_stories.title: Rewriting the Sound Engine
key_stories.summary: Kaze hit long-standing limitations in Mario 64’s audio—especially the inability to add new SFX—so he scrapped and rebuilt the engine. The rewrite produced major speed, memory, and polyphony gains but introduced temporary glitches heard on-stream.
key_stories.challenge: Vanilla engine too slow, memory-hungry, and blocked new sound effects.
key_stories.process: Reverse-engineered original, wrote slimmer replacement, live-tested and debugged synth-wave red-coin bug on stream.
key_stories.outcome: New engine is 80 % faster, supports 32 notes, and frees memory; minor bugs remain.
key_stories.key_quote: The sound engine is now around 80 % faster than vanilla … so now songs can be much more complex and it's not even more expensive.

key_stories.title: Designing a Post-Victory World
key_stories.summary: Kaze dislikes games that reset after the final boss, so he’s planning persistent post-game exploration. He wrestles with spacing Yoshi villages, Bowser’s gate, and filler areas to keep traversal fun.
key_stories.challenge: Prevent overworld from feeling empty while keeping narrative separation between locations.
key_stories.process: Sketches, Blender block-outs, live feedback; adds mountains, hammocks, climbable trees as soft walls; scales down mountain village by 20 %.
key_stories.outcome: Layout direction set: largest level with ~30 stars, multiple biomes, and post-game roaming.
key_stories.key_quote: I want the player to save the world and then be like, yep, this is the world now.

key_stories.title: Making the Game ‘Legal’
key_stories.summary: To mitigate Nintendo risk, Kaze considers replacing every remaining Nintendo texture. Biobak leads texture work, but extra artists may be hired late in development.
key_stories.challenge: Potential legal action if non-original assets remain.
key_stories.process: Audit of current textures; public acknowledgment of need for full replacement.
key_stories.outcome: Plan to recruit more texture artists once core development stabilizes.
key_stories.key_quote: If I want this to all be legal, I would technically need custom textures for everything.
